revised_title: Geological and Geographic Exploration of Chinese Tibet
tldr: The authors conducted a geological and physical geography exploration of Chinese Tibet during the Percy Sladen expedition in 1922. They studied the mountainous highlands of south-western China, Chinese Tibet, and northeastern Burma, focusing on the geological structure and the interaction of mountain movements from two distant periods. The research aimed to understand the mountain structure of Chinese Tibet and the development of its physiography, providing valuable insights into the region's geology and geography.
scientific_discipline: Earth Sciences > Geology and Physical Geography
